Force of infection equations

Source: R/CascadeCEA-Model-0-Function-FoI.R
FoI.Rd

FoI combines parameters related to HIV transmission via needle sharing, heterosexual sex and homosexual sex

FoI(
  y,
  no,
  uoC,
  ns,
  usC,
  eO,
  eS,
  sigmaFM,
  sigmaMF,
  sigmaM,
  tau,
  eff.prep,
  d,
  s,
  eff.oat,
  cov.ssp,
  eff.ssp = eff.ssp,
  s.multi,
  bal = F
)

Arguments

y

number of individuals in each compartment (n.gp*19 matrix)
no

number of opposite sexual partners for each compartment (n.gp*19 matrix)
uoC

condom use adjustment term for opposite sex (n.gp*19 matrix)
ns

number of same sexual partners for each compartment (18*19 matrix)
usC

condom use adjustment term for same sex (18*19 matrix)
eO

assortative coefficient for heterosexual mixing between ethnic groups (vector of 3 for white, black, hispanic)
eS

assortative coefficient for homosexual mixing between ethnic groups (vector of 3 for white, black, hispanic)
sigmaFM

probability of transmission by F->M for 16 HIV+ states
sigmaMF

probability of transmission by M->F for 16 HIV+ states
tau

probability of transmission by injection for 16 HIV+ states
eff.prep

% reduction in risk of infection for PrEP
d

number of injection
s

proportion of injections that are shared (9 groups)
eff.oat

% reduction in # of shared injections reduced due to OAT
cov.ssp

coverage of syringe services program
simgaM

probability of transmission by same sex for 16 HIV+ states
outputs

matrix of dim c(n.gp,2) with row of each group. second column for PrEP
ind

index for groups of people to be mixed
ind.low

index for groups of people at low risk of HIV transmission
ass.e

Assortativity coefficient
n

Number of contacts
uC

condom use matrix
indM

indicator of male partner
indF

indicator of female partner

Value

Sufficient contact rate (sum of transmission via needle sharing, opposite and sex same contacts)

Complete mixing matrix

Contents
